me.wobblyyyy.pathfinder2.plugin

Class PathfinderPlugin

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.wobblyyyy.pathfinder2.plugin.PathfinderPlugin

  • public abstract class PathfinderPlugin
extends java.lang.Object
    A PathfinderPlugin is a piece of code that can be written to modify the behavior of the library to an extent not normally possible through regular usage of the Pathfinder API.

    In order to load a plugin, you have to use Pathfinder.loadPlugin(PathfinderPlugin). This will... well, it'll load the plugin. Every time a plugin is loaded, it's onLoad(Pathfinder) method will be called.

    This class can be used by overriding the methods (such as onLoad(Pathfinder)) to change their functionality. I'd suggest you look at either (1) the source code or (2) the JavaDoc for it, mostly because I'm pretty lazy and don't have the energy to type all of that up right now.

    If you'd like to load a plugin every time an instance of Pathfinder is created, check out the Pathfinder.addAutoLoadPlugin(PathfinderPlugin) method, which allows you to... well, it allows you to add an automatically loading plugin, as the name would suggest. I'd suggest you just use the regular Pathfinder.loadPlugin(PathfinderPlugin) method so as not to cause any issues with problematic plugins, but maybe that's just me.

    Since:
    0.6.1
    Author:
    Colin Robertson

        pathfinder - the instance of Pathfinder that the plugin was loaded by.

      • preClear

        public void preClear(Pathfinder pathfinder)

        pathfinder - the instance of Pathfinder that the plugin was loaded by.

                        Zone zone)

        Parameters:

        zone - the zone that was just entered.

      • whileInsideZone

        public void whileInsideZone(Pathfinder pathfinder,
                            Zone zone)
        Whenever Pathfinder detects that it's in a zone, this method will be called.
        Parameters:
        pathfinder - the instance of Pathfinder that the plugin was loaded by.
        zone - the zone that Pathfinder is currently inside.

      • onStartFollower

        public void onStartFollower(Pathfinder pathfinder,
                            Follower follower)

        follower - the follower that was just started.
